entityId.localType: State Records of South Australia Series ID

nameEntry.part: Case books - Labour Ward, McBride Maternity Hospital

biogHist.abstract: This series contains volumes of clinical notes relating to births in the Labour Ward at McBride Maternity Hospital.
biogHist.p: A Research Centre Members card, obtainable at the Archives, is required to research records held at State Records.

Although some very early records relating to children in care in South Australia are open for access, most records relating to children are subject to a 100 year restriction, particularly those which contain personal information about individuals. Written permission must be obtained from the government agency which created the record in order to access restricted material. To obtain permission a Freedom of Information (FOI) request form must be submitted to the relevant government department. State Records staff will be able to assist you with this.

Entries in these volumes include name, doctor and/or nurses present, date and time of delivery, baby's gender and weight and clinical notes relating to the birth. Prior to 1960, the records appear to relate to married women only and entries give married surname only until 1958, when full names are given. Entries for unmarried women are included from 1961. Some give first name only. Sections of writing in volumes 4, 22 and 25 are faded or illegible due to previous water damage. Volume 41 also contains loose statistical sheets that provide weekly totals of adults and babies in the hospital from 1959 to 1964. Arranged chronologically by date of admission to the ward.
